actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to permit military service performed by an individual after 1956 to be credited under the civil service retirement program, even though such individual is eligible for social security benefits, if such individual has elected to have such service excluded in the computation of such benefits.

summary.text: Permits military service performed by an individual after 1956 to be credited under the civil service retirement program, even though such individual is eligible for social security benefits, if such individual has elected to have such service excluded in the computation of such benefits. (Amends 5 U.S.C. 8332(j))

titles.title: A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to permit military service performed by an individual after 1956 to be credited under the civil service retirement program, even though such individual is eligible for social security benefits, if such individual has elected to have such service excluded in the computation of such benefits.
